results.name: Number of ways to place nonintersecting diagonals in convex (n+3)-gon so as to create exactly one triangle.
link: D. Birmajer, J. B. Gil, and M. Weiner, Colored partitions of a convex polygon by noncrossing diagonals, arXiv:1503.05242 [math.CO], 2015.
example: a(1)=0 since there are no dissections of a convex quadrilateral with exactly one triangle.
a(2)=5 because we can place one diagonal in a pentagon 5 different ways, each time creating one triangle and one quadrilateral.
maple: a:=n->sum(binomial(n+k+2, k)*binomial(n-k-1, k-1), k = 1 .. trunc((1/2)*n)): (1, seq(a(n), n=1..30));
